paragraphs.context: The solar system has eight planets: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Mercury is the closest to the Sun. Venus has a thick toxic atmosphere. Earth supports life. Mars is known as the Red Planet. Jupiter is the largest planet and has a Great Red Spot. Saturn has prominent rings. Uranus rotates on its side. Neptune has supersonic winds.

paragraphs.context: NASA has conducted missions like Apollo for moon landings, Voyager for deep space exploration, and Mars rovers to explore the Martian surface. It also operates telescopes like Hubble and James Webb for astronomical observations.

paragraphs.context: Black holes are formed from collapsed stars and have gravitational pulls so strong that not even light can escape. They are found in the centers of galaxies and come in different sizes: stellar, intermediate, and supermassive.

paragraphs.context: SpaceX is a private space company developing rockets like Falcon 9 and Starship. It launched Crew Dragon with astronauts to the ISS. Its Starlink project aims to provide global internet using satellites.

paragraphs.context: Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial bodies like stars, planets, and galaxies. Telescopes and satellites help astronomers gather data. Important phenomena include supernovae, pulsars, quasars, and exoplanets.
